text: it's way better than I imagined it is
actually really hard to describe I mean
just the whole ride into space on the
Soyuz rocket what a phenomenal machine
so powerful such as smooth launch and
then arrival onboard the International
Space Station and adapting to this
weightless environment and being able to
go to the cupola and look at that
amazing view of planet Earth is way
beyond my expectations
well the first 24 hours is pretty rough
every time you turn a corner or move
your head looking up and down left and
right your ears your vestibular system
is sending signals to the brain
that don't doesn't really match your
eyes and so your brains trying to work
out the two differences and so you do
feel disorientated and dizzy but I've
been amazed at how quickly the body has
adapted on my second morning I woke up
feeling fresh ready to go to work and
have had no problem since
the most unexpected thing I think was
the blackness of space because we always
talked about seeing the view of planet
Earth and how beautiful it is and so you
you become to expect that but what
people don't mention that much is just
when you look the opposite direction and
you see how dark space is I mean it's
the black is black and you realize just
how small the earth is in that blackness
and that was a real surprise to me
the tea actually tastes surprisingly
good I was really delighted so I have my
Tia and my method of using a kind of
teapot into canting it from one pouch to
another it is working really well so yes
I'm enjoying my tea up here and as
regards to water we don't boil water for
any of our cooking there the water
dispenser is only hot it's about 87
degrees Celsius but we're in the same
atmosphere here that you are back on
earth the same pressure same temperature
about the same humidity the only thing
is different up here is we have about 10
times the level of carbon dioxide but so
water will boil at a hundred degrees up
here no different - back on planet Earth
we're showering with just wet flannels
that we heat them up
up by we've got a portable water
dispenser we can put some hot water in
that soapy flannel and then we basically
have a body wash it's a little bit like
camping for six months you keep yourself
clean as best you can
we've got special shampoo called no
rinse shampoo so we can wash our hair
without having to rinse it out with
water and that's basically how we keep
clean
I definitely haven't mastered it I'll
give you a trial I'll show you just how
bad it is
practice makes perfect
give me another week
I feel a little bit isolated from
everything to be quite honest with you
from my two weeks in quarantine just
focusing on the mission that's ahead and
now being up on board the space station
we've launched straight into a very busy
program but you know I'm really keen to
keep in touch with people back on earth
and once I get my space legs and we
settle down a bit I'll be able to share
this mission as much as possible
